ssot__AuthorizationFormConsent__dlm.name: Authorization Form Consent
ssot__AuthorizationFormConsent__dlm.description: The Authorization Form Consent DMO represents capturing where, when, and how a party gives consent for a form, a set of terms and conditions, or a privacy policy.

ssot__AuthorizationFormTextId__c.description: A reference ID to an authorization form’s text and language settings.

ssot__Id__c.description: A unique ID used as the primary key for the Authorization Form Consent DMO.

ssot__ConsentCapturedDateTime__c.description: The date and time consent was captured.

ssot__ConsentStatusId__c.description: A reference ID to the status of consent, for example opted in or out of data collection.

ssot__DataSourceId__c.description: A reference ID for the logical name for a system that is the source of records identified by an external record ID.

ssot__DataSourceObjectId__c.description: A reference ID for the logical name of the object where this record came from, whether that is a name of a cloud storage file or another connector’s external object.

ssot__EffectiveFromDate__c.description: The date when a consent form is in effect.

ssot__EffectiveToDate__c.description: The date when a consent form is no longer in effect.

ssot__EngagementChannelTypeId__c.description: A reference ID to the channels supported by individual preferences.

ssot__EntityId__c.description: A reference ID to the entity related to the authorization consent form.

ssot__ExternalRecordId__c.description: A reference ID to an external data source system.

ssot__ExternalSourceId__c.description: A reference ID for the system in which the external record ID was assigned.

ssot__InternalOrganizationId__c.description: A reference ID to the business unit or other internal organization that owns the business account.

ssot__Name__c.description: The name of the authorization consent form.

ssot__PartyId__c.description: A reference ID to the parent party, for example, an individual, business, or affiliation group.

ssot__PartyRoleId__c.description: A reference ID to an associated party role, for example, a customer, supplier, or competitor.
